active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the potential impacts of a contractor data breach involving CUI (e.g., financial loss, regulatory fines, reputational damage). How do standards like NIST SP 800-171 mitigate these risks? Support your arguments with specific control families and real-world examples from sources like the SolarWinds supply chain attack.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Contractor Security Standards (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Personnel Security > Third-Party and Contractor Personnel Security > Third-Party Security Requirements > Contractor Security Standards). Incorporate these elements: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: Use to inspire scenario questions. - Scaffolding: Distribute cards across 4 layers (Layer 1: 12 cards foundation terms; Layer 2: 13 components/frameworks; Layer 3: 13 implementation; Layer 4: 12 integration). - Bloom's: Balance as per schema. Content Sources (complete & authoritative): - NIST SP 800-171 Rev 3: 17 families [LIST ALL FROM SCAFFOLDING LAYER 2], protects CUI in nonfederal systems. https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-171r3 - CMMC 2.0: https://dodcio.defense.gov/CMMC/ - NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-53r5 - ISO 27001:2022: https://www.iso.org/standard/82875.html - SCRM: NIST IR 8276. Generate 50 flashcards following EXACT schema: [Front] {question type} [Back] **Answer:** {bold correct} **Explanation:** {pedagogical tie-in} **Reference:** {source+URL} **Bloom Level:** {level} **Scaffolding Layer:** {1-4} Vary formats, use distractor protocol strictly. Ensure university-level rigor, active recall. Output as numbered list.
